greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Fermat quotients, mod p: ((2^(p-1) - 1)/p) mod p = A007663(n) mod p.
reference: Paulo Ribenboim, "The Little Book of Bigger Primes", Springer-Verlag, 2004, p. 232.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
formula: Fermat quotients mod p = A007663: (1, 3, 9, 93, 315,...) mod p; where the Fermat quotients for base 2 = (2^(p-1) - 1). Applies to the odd primes.
example: The Fermat prime(base 2) for 7 = 9 = (2^6 - 1)/7. Then 9 mod 7 = 2.
maple: a := 2 : for n from 2 to 120 do p := ithprime(n) ; fq := (a^(p-1)-1)/p ; printf("%d,",fq mod p) ; od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 28 2008
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jun 08 2007
ext: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 28 2008
